Tied to the pier there are two boats, a NOVI LOBSTER BOAT a BOSTON WHALER with a guys we've never seen at the wheel (random getaway hires). The TRIAD members get into the NO and chug away. Fitzy carries the SUITCASES OF MONEY onto BOSTON WHALER and it takes off. COSTELLO turns to Billy.

See, no surveillance here. They didn't figure we had a navy. Always figure an exit for your business partners. What with everything all dug up, you can't trust a slant to find the Mass Pike and, with or without Staties out front, frankly I don't approve of orientals driving to begin with.
What about us, Frank?   What're we gonna do?
We depart. We didn't commit no illegalities.
BILLY is stunned. Admiring.
Except sell the ching chongs a bunch of fuckin' plastic.
The CHINESE GUYS, staring back, chug away down the canal the lobster boat. BILLY watches COSTELLO go, admiringly, then follows him.

A few blocks from the target building, a Police Tactical stops the departing Triad cars with a roadblock. As offic approach the cars they realize they are empty except for hired Caucasian drivers. An officer reports this to the command center.

Colin is asleep on the couch, in a bachelor disaster of Chinese food boxes. Something on TV: "Audition." A key in the door: He wakes as MADOLYN comes in carrying a bag of coffees and a BOX OF EFFECTS.
Good Morning.
MADOLYN smiles at him, also shy.
Good morning.
I beat the movers.
How was the last night in the, ah, old establishment?
(putting the box on the kitchen counter) Lonely.
I'm glad to hear that.   It sucked here, too.
They kiss.    MADOLYN takes in the apartment.
I'm gonna thank your Uncle Alphonsus for the square footage.
Uncle Alphonsus is in heaven.   So am I.
MADOLYN unpacks food.       Coffee.   Croissants.
French donut?
(re: box of stuff) Yeah. Hey, can I...
Sure yeah.

He sorts through the box. It's all Madolyn's key stuff - mug, a few critical books...framed family pictures, breakables...and comes up with: A PHOTOGRAPH of a young Madolyn standing in front of a North East rust belt slum.
Well, we're not having this out.
What?
MADOLYN isn't prepared to be at cross-purposes. But she i taken aback. She puts the photo quietly away. Contaminate
You don't see any pictures of where I came from. Look, I respect who you are, but not in the living room. We might have company.
Company?
She laughs.    COLIN looks at a diploma.     Veritas.
Why work for the state?
Why not?   You do.
Not forever, and you don't have to. You've got degrees...you're a hot shit... I mean, what you do, why make as much as a guidance counselor?
(deadpan, over her coffee cup) I believe in public service.
COLIN stares at her.
Now you're just being ridiculous.
(kissing him, and intently:) You like me living here?
(hands down her shorts) Yes I do.
THE PHONE (landline with mobile handset) rings.
Answer it.     You live here.
MADOLYN, not 100% confused by his seizing on the interruption, gets the phone.
Mayor Sullivan's Office.
After a moment she holds the receiver out to COLIN.
(whispering) I'm sorry!
Who is it?
I think it's a guy with a, ah, (She touches her throat, and whispers) A cancer guy.
COLIN reaches in his pocket and looks at his cellphone: d A bad mistake in his situation. He crams the phone into a table charger beside the landline and takes the handset.
Hello?
COLIN exits the kitchen.
(to Madolyn) Something for work.
MADOLYN looks after him. She doesn't start eating again, watches Colin. She is seen staring at him through the following scene.
What the fuck is it with your phone?
COSTELLO, with his collar turned up, is walking along the floats. Wearing a headset. INTERCUT TERRACE OF COLIN'S APARTMENT/CHELSEA YACHT CLUB.
COLIN hunches, closing the glass door, and glancing in at Madolyn.
Nothin', nothin'. It doesn't have any power, that's all. It just happened once.
Was that that shrink cunt answered the phone?
Yes. Yes. As I said, she was gonna move in, so she moved in.
You better get organized, quick.
Last time I checked, I tipped you off and you're not in jail.
Are you listening to me?
Yes.
Are listening to me, son? Do you like Little Miss Thing sucking your cock?
COLIN looks in at MADOLYN.
Yes. Yes I do.
COLIN is frustrated.
So earn it. (a beat) I'm gettin' the feeling we got a cop in my crew.
I been gettin' that same feeling.
He's one of yours. Inside. Have you seen anything?
Look, I have no access to undercover files in Queenan's department. It's locked up. Queenan and Dignam run the snitches. They don't give anybody a peep. I'm doing the best...
(interrupting) Your best? What do you think we're in, the fuckin' haberdashery business?
COLIN takes a breath, tries to reason and mind his place.
Please Frank, if you don't relax I can't relax. Let's start with this...get me all the information on the people around you last night. Everyone that works for you. Get me real first names. Get me...
(interrupting Colin) Get you? Give you? Who the fuck do you work for?

Okay, Frank...I'm sorry...could you please get me social security numbers, ah, I need drivers license numbers, full names, dates of birth, anything like that. Bank account numbers, everything that you don't get from a criminal record or, or a wrap sheet or a...

(relenting a little) Collie, calm down or you'll shoot in your pants. I'll get you the records and whatnot. You'll have 'em but listen to me son, don't disappoint me on this, or some other guy will be putting their cock up Little Miss Freud's ass.
Costello hangs up and walks along and sees QUEENAN and DI step out.
How are you, Francis?
My mother called me Francis.
I know she did. And your father called you the tumor.
COSTELLO, not liking that:
Oh, what did your father call you, Charlie? Oh yeah, I forgot, he wasn't around.
Where are the real microprocessors, Frank?
Microprocessors...oh yeah, I heard that story. You arrested some Chinese government guy at the border carrying some light sockets or somethin'.
I can't wait to wipe that fuckin' smirk off your face.
(to Dignam) Wouldn't you rather wipe my ass for me?
I will get you, Frank.
If you could've you would've but I guess you like to go at your own pace.
From off-stage we hear a young, angelic GIRLS CHOIR begin sing.
Excuse me, I've got a date with some angels.
As Costello walks away:
Sooner than you think, Francis.
COLIN, looking worried, folding his phone away, comes int the apartment. MADOLYN is staring at him.
What?
You have a boss that has a laryngectomy?
No, no, no. That was a guy who works for me.
You're lying to me.

Not exactly. (the charming Colin:) There are certain things I will not be able to talk to you about. I cannot allow you to jeopardize an ongoing investigation. (Or your own life.) (more seriously, after a long beat) There really are things connected to my job that you can't ask about. That you don't want to know about.
(after a beat) Okay, then say that.
COLIN looks at her steadily:         if she's serious, sh gold.
I will.    Thank you.
He kisses her.       The DOORBELL RINGS.
That's the movers.
You still wanna stay?
I do.
The doorbell safely ringing, Colin kisses Madolyn.
(re: doorbell) All right. All right.       I'm coming.
DIGNAM is alone. We see Queenan's empty desk in a fall of light. We see Dignam's arm, wrist, phone, an expensive he watch.
I'm gonna get on a plane unless you put Queenan on the phone.
Queenan had a funeral to go to. This is my shift. Calm down.

location: IM PEI TYPE FOOTBRIDGE WITH A PEDESTRIAN CONVEYOR. D

text: (INTERCUT)
BILLY is talking on the phone, in a fury.
Why shouldn't I get on a fucking plane? Meet up? Do you actually want me dead? There's a rat in your unit. That's a fact. You just don't know it. Where's Queenan?
He's not here.
They knew you had cameras in the building. You have a leak from the inside. It's real. Smoke him out.
And how do we do that Mr... fucking genius who didn't even graduate the academy?

Disinform. Let it slip to SIU that you're getting a sealed wiretap warrant for Costello's apartment. Don't tell anyone in our department but tell SIU. Flush it and see if it comes out of the pipe on my end. That's first. Narrow it down. Where's Queenan.
Are you deaf? He's not here. Call me when you get something real.
BILLY is in a full-on panic attack. He takes a pill, lean back against a wall, closes his eyes. The second phone ri He stares at it: opens it.
It's me.
Madolyn and Billy sit at a table. Talking like friends no emphatically non-clinical. Billy is zoned out, preoccupie nervous.
I'm assuming you want to change things, you know, change the people you know, change the people you meet, change everything, anything. Too many choices can see like no choice at all...
Confucius say that?
So you do...something radical.
"Something radical," huh?

So how long you been with this guy?
Oh, four months. About four months.
You love this guy?
It's pretty serious, yeah, it is.
A head case or anything?    I'm just curious...
No more than I am.
Then you're lucky.   Considering the odds, right?
He lifts his cup to drink.
Good, give him a shot.
This may not be exactly what Madolyn wants to hear. But s nods.
Doctors aren't supposed to have illusions.
Yeah, that's because of vastly superior intelligence. Godlike, really.
Smiles, called on her shit.
OK, I'm in a serious, newly serious, relationship...there are...ups and downs...everybody has doubts, problems -- I mean doubts.
She realizes she may have glazed and gone a little too fa "problems".
What would you do if he was standing right there and saw us?
I'd lie. To keep things on an even keel. You know all about it.
The BANKROBBER, a junkie, wakes up to a vision: JESUS, indicating the sacred heart. BILLY smashes the glass and the frame over the guy's head
MISTER FRENCH has lit a cherry-bomb. He throws it. He han out fireworks to KIDS.
BILLY shoves him down on the couch and crams the gun to h head.
You take off an armored car at the Dedham Mall and what do you do. Do you pay guineas in Providence?
Fucking now I do.
What the fuck do you do.
What, I pay Costello and wait for him to trade me to the FBI? Cause that's what he does.
FBI? What the fuck are you talking about.
{Firecrackers off}
Oh my God, is that French out there?
(grabbing him by the shirt) What the fuck did you just say about the FBI?
Forget what I said. I'm fucking high, I'm high.
Firecrackers continue to go off outside. The BANKROBBER k what this means.
Whatever's going through your very poor, very limited, brain...I'm not going to hurt you. Just tell me what you just fucking said.
Forget it, I'm high, I must be high, I would never say what you thought I said.

As the firecracker sounds increase outside (Maybe French' "Do what you have to do"), BILLY, no way out of what he h to do, glances at the window, shoots the guy through the kneecap. BLOOD sprays everywhere. The bankrobber screams.
Tell me what the fuck you said.

(covered with blood) Why do you think he's not arrested? Costello's a protected FBI informant. He'll trade you out. (a beat) I thought I was supposed to go into shock. I'm not in shock. It fucking hurts. It fucking hurts.
BILLY gets out of the house.
MISTER FRENCH is benignly watching kids light cherry bomb
Let's go.
ON SOUND: Sextet from LUCIA di LAMMAMOOR.

From behind COSTELLO'S HEAD, which almost fills the frame see a blur of beautiful color. ON STAGE, an opera is in progress----LUCIA DI LAMMAMOOR done with masks. CUT TO COSTELLO, revealing Costello's rapt face and PAN to revea his Left a beautiful WHITE PROSTITUTE. PAN back over COSTELLO'S face to reveal a beautiful BLACK PROSTITUTE. head_text.subj: EXT. QUEENAN'S HOUSE IN WEST ROXBURY. NIGHT

text: A street of three-deckers. QUEENAN gets out of his unmark cruiser. As he does: BILLY steps out into the light. The men stare at each other, each lit by their own streetligh
Hey, it's me.
What do you want? What are you doing here?
Come here.
QUEENAN approaches him.
Costello is giving people up to the FBI.
QUEENAN stares.
The FBI?
He gives information to the FBI. He's a protected informant. Aren't they trying to make it a Federal case? And it never gets made?
(realizing he has to be very careful) Go around the back. Go around the back.
BILLY sits on a bench in a hallway, exhausted, staring. T SACRED HEART and JFK are on the walls. QUEENAN comes alon the hall.
My wife's asleep. She left supper out. Come and have something to eat.
BILLY shakes his head.
No, I...
We'll talk in the kitchen. Come and have something to eat.
BILLY follows him towards the lighted kitchen door.
COLIN is watching ELLERBY hit golf balls. Well.
Congratulations. Haven't seen a guy like you since me. You'll be transferred to Internal Investigations but you will continue to work right where you are in the Special Investigation Unit.
I don't get it.
We are all convinced that Costello has at least one mole in the Special Investigation Unit.
Right.
You'll investigate. Everybody. Anybody.
Well, that's just a dream job for a cop.
We have considered all possible candidates. You have an immaculate record. Some people never trust a guy with an immaculate record. I do. (a beat) I have an immaculate record.
ELLERBY hits a drive.
Play golf?
No.
That's a pity. Pretty much sucks as a game but you get to form relationships. (a beat) How's the wedding coming along?
Everything's great. On schedule. She's a doctor.

Outstanding. That's good. Marriage is an important part of getting ahead. You don't want anyone thinking you're a homo. Married guy seems stable. People look at a wedding ring and think: someone can stand the son of a bitch. Ladies see the wedding ring and know immediately that you must have some cash and that your cock works.
Oh, it's working. Overtime.
I'm glad to hear that.
Hits a drive. Ponk.

HEAVY EQUIPMENT stands on the thrashed earth. Hoardings. BILLY crosses the road under what remains of the Expressw and after hiding in an angle of the building and cocking gun in his pocket bangs on the door of a dead bar. The do is unlocked by: DELAHUNT.

It's another of COSTELLO'S "locations". BILLY looks aroun Every man from the previous night is there--but no COSTEL DELAHUNT closes the door behind him and bars it. Men are oddly enough filling out forms. These are not men used to pencil and paper. Billy is nodded at.
Boss wants your real name, your social, your license number, all your bank account numbers.
I don't have a bank account.
I'm a cash business myself.
What's he doing, setting up IRAs?
You fill in the papers, real name, all your numbers, no fucking around, and then we all wait here.
No, I ain't.

MISTER FRENCH goes off into a separate room. BILLY takes paper and, sitting at the bar beside FITZY, writes down h information. The other men are mostly finished and DELAHU is collecting the papers. DELAHUNT tosses the brown envel on the bar.
Put the forms in there.
I don't know if this is how you spell Citizens'.
BILLY glances at what FITZY is crawling: CITTIZINS TRUST.
No, no, no. Jesus Christ.
He takes the brown envelope, and writes on it CITIZENS.
What are you, retarded? That ain't right.
BILLY gives up. Both of their forms are stuffed in an envelope. BILLY gets up.
Billy, he said to stay here.
I'm not sitting in this room without a tetanus shot. I'm not staying.
Where you going?
BILLY goes out. DELAHUNT puts his coat on. He picks up th brown envelope on which CITIZENS TRUST is written.
BILLY is holding his bottle of tranqs. He traces with his finger the doctor's name...MADOLYN MADDEN. His "police" p vibrates and he takes it out.
Follow the envelope.
BILLY deletes the IM and dials Queenan directly.
Why can't Ellerby's guys? SIU.
QUEENAN closes his door.
They can't. They are compromised.
Costello emerges, in an overcoat. Carrying the envelope. gets into his Oldsmobile. BILLY starts his car and follow

Dark theater, movie in progress. Wobbly porno music. A th audience of raincoat artists. The door opens and COSTELLO enters. He moves slowly down the aisle and sees: COLIN sitting alone. He sits down in front of COLIN. Costello is wearing the dildo.   He watches the movie, moaning.
Oh yeah, be dirty.
Colin goes for his gun.    Costello gets up, shows him th dildo.
See   anything you like?
COLIN unnerved, recognizing COSTELLO now.
Jesus Christ, Frank, I almost shot you.
Frank sits, closer to Colin.
You're not indulging in self abuse are you?
Frank, we got problems.
I hope you're not turning into one of those sob sisters, who wants to get caught. You're not crackin' up are you?
I don't crack up.
Pick a place where any cop could see you...
Why did you show up then?
I own the place.
Why am I not fuckin' surprised. Look...
You're gettin' reassigned.
How the fuck did you know that?
Where'd they put you?
I have to find myself.
COSTELLO chuckles, truly enjoying this.
You're telling me, sonny boy.
I have to find the guy you have in the department.
With everybody looking up their own ass and you looking for yourself, I put my money on nobody finding nothing.
We see in Colin's face hurt and hatred for Costello.   Hi idol doesn't like him.
Frank, for me, you've got to lay low.
Laying low is not what I do.

Yeah, big fuckin' daddy Frank. Lookit, Frank, what good am I to you if you don't listen to me? Queenan's compartmentalizing. He's fuckin' smart, you know that. I will find this rat if you let me do it my way. If you let me do my job.

Okay. (gives him the envelope) But Colin, I hope I won't have to remind you, that if you don't find that cheese eating rat bastard in your department so we can give him a halo, most likely it won't be me who pays for it.
COLIN nods, sweat on his lip.
Why would you need to remind me of that? I didn't know that would I be any good at what I do? Trust me, I know how to do this.
It involves lying, and I'm pretty fucking good at that, right?
(looking at the screen) Maybe it's because it's always been so easy for me to get cunt that I never understood jerking off in a theatre.
Costello gets up to go.
Who knows what's easy? Collie, take care of business.

The door opens again at the back of the theater and we se BILLY in a dark back seat. COSTELLO, after hesitating as Colin sweats, shoves the brown envelope to COLIN, and goe BILLY receives a text message: "Get visual ID suspect." H slumps in his seat as Costello marches up the aisle and o of the theater. He has barely recovered from this when: The dark shape of COLIN is moving rapidly towards and thr the emergency exit beside the screen. Billy follows.

head_text.subj: INT. CINEMA BACK STAIRCASE AND ALLEY. NIGHT

text: It's open, and gives on to what Boston keeps trying to ca the Theater District and what keeps being The Combat Zone COLIN vanishes around a corner. BILLY follows, looks left right, then goes after

location: A STREET OF CHINESE SHOPS. CONTINUOUS

text: COLIN, who is walking along, putting the envelope into hi coat. BILLY is speeding up, moving through pedestrians, despera to see Colin's face. COLIN will be caught up to within seconds. He turns down another street. BILLY starts into a half-run. He turns th corner. ANOTHER STREET painted with neon light (quiet).
COLIN is halfway down the street.

BILLY follows. BILLY is nearly up to COLIN on this quieter street (And COLIN is aware of the tail) when... BILLY'S cellphone rings. His phone has fucked up, as they do. Instead of turning around, COLIN accelerates. The onl thing on his agenda is to not have his face seen. BILLY spins into a door-opening and silences the ringer.
Make arrest.
COLIN takes a right at the end of the street, into an all

head_text.subj: EXT. AROUND THE NEXT CORNER. MOMENTS LATER

text: COLIN is waiting, in a doorway of his own. He has a knife open in his hand. He waits, listening to (faltering) footsteps: a MAN, face invisible in shadow, turns the cor COLIN pulls him into the doorway and rips upwards with a knife. As the body falls we see: it isn't Billy. It's a CHINESE COLIN backs away in horror, and hurries off down the stre

COLIN, sweating, staggering, hurries along. No sign of Bi no sign of a follower. But he does notice: CCTV cameras a the intersection. He spins and gets out of there, heading through. CHINATOWN. Colin, holding his envelope, walks, sweating, fast, then faster, past repeated ideograms in n (the ideograms say--flash--"Departed").

BILLY has lost Colin. He hears a hubbub from the corner w a small crowd of Chinese speakers is gathering and pushes through the crowd to see: blood running on the pavement. BILLY backs away, gets out of there.
COLIN is looking at CCTV tapes. We see COLIN, unrecogniza on cheap video. Then we see a blurred image of BILLY. Crossing the street in beats. No more use as ID than the Shroud of Turin.
Through grated windows we can see Madolyn finishing up he packing. BILLY KNOCKS on the door, which leads only into Madolyn's basement apartment. A long beat and she opens t door. The chain on.
Your name's on the pill label. I thought you weren't supposed to be in the book, in case of obsessive patients.
How obsessive are you?
Medium.
Are you okay? Why are you here?
I really liked our conversations. I've been...regretting that we didn't continue...our conversations.
I'm glad you want to see me...it's nice to see you...I enjoyed talking...I enjoyed having coffee with you, very much...but I don't see people...I don't see people in my home.
Billy gets soaked.

BILLY looks around and sees: boxes, transition. The furni already gone. An air-mattress on the floor. There are sti tea things on the counter. A basic life is still possible here. Madolyn has been making tea here, sleeping here, reading in bed. Billy, soaked, a drowned rat, is looking vulnerable and honest.
Thanks. If this is inappropriate... I can leave.
MADOLYN takes a moment to react.
No, it's, it's, it's not inappropriate...you're not a patient...
You moving in or out?
I still have three weeks on the lease...
BILLY is looking at THE PICTURE to which Colin objected. young girl in front of a rust belt slum, tilted in a box effects.
That's me.
Yeah, I know.
He hangs the picture on a nail.
(the kettle whistles OS) Would you like a cup of tea?
BILLY nods.
Yeah. Yeah I would. Thank you.

Madolyn leaves him looking vaguely around the apartment. the kitchen, it appears that Madolyn has forgotten how to make a cup of tea. She perseveres, comes out holding two cups. Billy is looking at the handful of books still in t apartment.
Do you want some...
Sugar?   No...

She hands him the cup of tea. Strung out, he spills his t slightly, unobserved by Madolyn. Madolyn looks over at th bed, the book, the lamp, the incontrovertible evidence th she's probably really, in fact, not that into Colin..
I've always needed my own place.
Hedging your bets?
No. I'm not "hedging my best"...I told you when we had coffee...There's a choice. You choose...you have to make a...
Decision.
...decision...and stick by what...you choose...you have to...
Move in with your boyfriend?
Yes. Stick by what you...otherwise it's... I have to say that your vulnerability is really freaking me out right now. Is it real?
Yeah, I think so.
Tick...tick...tick.
You don't have cats.
No.
I like that. That's good.
Colin is still studying the blurry image of Billy.
In the tiny kitchen BILLY is kissing MADOLYN and unbutton her shirt. Her hands start to move to push him away. He continues.

Still studying the blurry image of Billy, COLIN tenses as someone comes into the office and switches off the tape. glances at his coat. The envelope is visible folded into breast pocket. He takes his coat and goes.
Wet empty streets. The "gaslights" are on. About midnight

A Costello business. The restaurant is closed for the nig One bartender is sweeping up and the other is counting th takings. In a darker alcove of the bar COSTELLO sits alon a broad table, drinking brandy. On sound, classical music a knocking is heard Costello looks up. A BARTENDER lets B in. COSTELLO watches Billy approach. We hear him sit down
You got a girlfriend?
No.   No.   What does that matter?
Depends. I'm sure you know by now there's an informer in my crew. Cop. Staties or Boston Police department, I'm not sure.
He pours Billy some brandy. Then starts to draw a sketch.
What about the FBI.
It ain't. Trust me. The ex-wife, an old friend or stupid...that's what brings you down in this business.
Stupid...Well, that leaves me out.
Past days, case like this...I killed everybody who works for me.
Better safe than sorry, I suppose.
On the other hand, back then, it was only five...or six...and French.
But COSTELLO, maybe, is sorry.
I look around at your guys. They're all murderers right? I think "could I do murder?" And all I can answer myself is, "what's the difference".
Give em up to the Almighty.   Like that.
Yeah, that's my point. You accuse me once, I put up with it. You accuse me twice, I quit. If you make me fear for my life, I put a fucking bullet in your head as if you were anybody else.
COSTELLO looks up. This is new: but he's impassive. And impressed.
(to Billy) You got something you want to say to me, William?

You're seventy fucking years old. One of these guys is going to pop you. As for running drugs, what the fuck. You don't need the pain in the ass, and they're going to catch you. And you don't need the money.
COSTELLO smiles, and continues with the sketch.    Later will light up the paper.
I haven't needed "the money" since I took Archie's milk money in the third grade. Tell the truth, I don't need pussy any more,but I still like it.

Point I'm making...you see...I got this rat...gnawing, cheese eating fucking rat...questions come up...questions...see, Bill, you're the new guy...and the girlfriend. Why don't you stay in the bar when I get the numbers. Your numbers. Everybody's numbers.
Is there something you want to ask me, Frank?
Start with, you agree there is a rat?
You said there is one. I base most of what I do on the idea that you're pretty fucking good at what you do.
Sure, sure, all that aside...but you Bill, what would you do?
COSTELLO sketching.

How many of these guys been with you long enough to be disgruntled? Who needs more money than you pay them? You don't pay much, you know. It's almost a feudal fuckin' enterprise. (COSTELLO nods, accepting this) The question is, who thinks that they would do what you do better than you?
Only one that can do what I do is me. You want to be me?
BILLY stares over a precipice: he knows this as well.
I probably could be you. I know that much. But I don't want to be you.
Heavy lies the crown...sort of thing.
FRENCH comes in from the kitchen.
Francis.
We're out of here, Mister Costello. You'll have to set the alarm.
(eyes on Billy) Thank you, Jimmy. See you tomorrow.
ON SOUND the door closes and locks.
There's a boat coming in, up in Gloucester. French will give you all the details.
COSTELLO leaves.
COSTELLO is on the phone. MISTER FRENCH is sitting on a stool, smoking. OPERA playing on sound.
You heard nothing?
No.
Nothing about drugs. Nothing about new guys, nothing about Gloucester?
No, Frank, not a thing. And I promise you I would have heard about it.
COSTELLO hangs up and turns to MISTER FRENCH.
You're sure. No other departments, no codes, like that...
Frank.   You can relax on this one.
Okay, Collie. I will.
Costello hangs up and turns to Mr. French.
(emotionally) It ain't Bill. No way, he says. Thank God for Billy.
Everybody is busy in the office. It's COLIN's first day o Internal Investigations. COLIN'S moving through the bullp COPS stare at him with resentment.
Morning.
He comes up to Queenan's door just as Dignam comes out. DIGNAM faces COLIN down.
A problem?
Yeah, I run rat fucks like you.   I don't like them.
The day you wouldn't take a promotion, you let me know. And I wouldn't even have a job if you did yours.
Fuck yourself.
I need to know the identity of your undercovers.
Blow me. Not literally, there's no promotion in it for ya.
He walks away. COLIN goes into Queenan's office.
QUEENAN puts the cig into a cup of water, and throws it i the trash.
Morning, Captain.
Look who's here. The Queen of the prom.
They are not happy with me. Especially Staff Sergeant Dignam.
What do you expect? Everybody knows you're assigned here to find Costello's rat. They want to find the leak as much as you do. What they do not want is to be accused of being the rat.
COLIN sits uneasily.
Fair enough. Well one of them has to be dirty, We know that, right?
Two days ago, my undercover guy in Costello's organization----
Who is that?
Lots of luck. (Not a chance.) You can go over my head, high as you like. You still won't get an answer.
Fair enough.
As I said, two days ago, my guy nearly found out who Costello's rat is. He lost him in the street.
Really?   Did he get a look at him?
Nothing that could help us?
Nah.
(swallows) (Too bad.) Any advice?   Generally?
Costello can't do (much) business without coordinating with his source... (gestures out window) Who is here. In SIU. Follow Costello and you'll find his rat.
COLIN realizes: Just follow Queenan and you'll find his r

(turns away) You're going to be looking at my people. Going through their bank statements, phone bills, medical records. Don't expect them to get you a coffee or invite you to their houses. Let me get you a coffee.
COLIN is sitting in his office alone, remembering what Queenan has just told him:
Follow Costello and you'll find his informer.

In the fishbowl of his glass office, COLIN is being stare by pissed-off cops. COLIN calms down. He opens the gray envelope. He takes out the forms that he was given by Costello, opens up POLICE PERSONNEL DATABASE and starts searching. He types in SS numbers. One, then another, the another. The result is always: "Person not found". He typ in Costigan, William M, hits return. It comes up: "Person found". COLIN keeps working.

MUGSHOTS of all of Costello's guys. He looks at them desperately...no one squares up with the blurred, impossi images he saw on the CCTV screen (which he has printed out).COLIN closes the curtains on his fishbowl office (no fast enough to avoid seeing Dignam give him the finger), locks his door. He picks up the phone.
Internal Investigations.
This is Sullivan. I need constant surveillance on Captain Queenan, starting right now.

head_text.subj: INT. COLIN AND MADOLYN'S NEW BEDROOM. SAME NIGHT

text: COLIN is lying in bed, his back to MADOLYN.
If I wasn't with the Mass State Police. If I did it full time,law school, I'd be through in a year. I'm thinking that. If I wasn't a trooper.
What's going on?
Nothing. Nothing. There's nothing going on. Just thinking.
Okay, all right. (thinking about it; blows a breath) And what about money?
I got some money. Another city...I'm thinking that.
Another city doesn't seem unattractive to Madolyn, who's her own cut-and-run crisis -- but maybe she can't believe that Colin is thinking about it. She blows a breath.
Another city? It'd be a clean slate.
COLIN is in hell.    He looks at her intensely.

I want you to know you don't gotta stay. If we're not going to make it, it's got to be you that gets out. I'm not capable (a beat) I'm fuckin' Irish, so I'll deal with something being wrong for the rest of my life.
Long pause.
Not a bad idea, another city.

text: FITZY and DELAHUNT are smoking on the sidewalk outside th restaurant.
Of course I know how to spot a cop.
Oh yeah, how's that?
If he's not paying attention to us, he's a cop.
A MAN across the street is looking into the window of an antique shop.
See that guy over there, he's a cop. He's not paying attention to us. He's a cop.
Lot of fucking cops.
A WOMAN walks by definitely ignoring both men, dragging a lapdog.
What kind of dog is that?
No response.
She's a cop.
She's probably the fucking Police Commissioner.

Too early to be opened for business. COSTELLO and NEW GUY six hard customers, come in through the fire door. At the BAR, BILLY is drinking coffee. He notices the NEW GUYS. O the boat Dublin toughs. COSTELLO and FRENCH come in from kitchen. FRENCH tells the NEW GUYS to move to the back. COSTELLO HAS BLOOD ON HIS SLEEVES. He comes over to the b and looks at BILLY.
You can get out of here.   This is the crew for tonight.
I thought I was on for that.
I changed my mind. Take the night off. (to Bartender) Jimmy, get the mop.
COSTELLO heads to the back of the restaurant. MISTER FREN grabs the BAR KNIFE from behind the bar. BILLY looks up a him.
Go out the back. Some guys answer the questions right. Some don't.
MISTER FRENCH goes towards the back of the restaurant, holding the big knife. BILLY closes his paper.

text: BILLY steps out, ignoring DELAHUNT and FITZY.
You're a cop.
Huh?
You're ignoring us. You're a cop. We're guessing who cops are. Most good looking women are cops.
Right. I'm going home. He's playing with his new boys.
See you later.
Later.
BILLY walks down the street and heads into an alley.   Ar the corner, he opens his phone.

He's moving something with all new guys. (A whole new crew.) I don't want to tell you what or where. It might be disinformation. It probably is. Just keep following him. I need to see you today. (a beat...reacting to Queenan, Billy continues) No. Today.

A DETECTIVE (DETECTIVE 1) is leading the team to trail af Queenan. On foot. A plug in his ear. Two other DETECTIVES in a sedan nearby. (These three detectives are new guys, never seen before, the I.I. surveillance team working for Colin).
Can I ask a question, Sergeant?
Yes, go ahead.
Why the fuck are we following Captain Queenan? To find out about the good Catholic life?
(angrily) I have to follow every lead, however unlikely, however fucking painful it might be to your delicate fucking sensibilities.
Who says I have delicate sensibilities?
I have reason to believe that Queenan is Costello's informer. Follow him, and don't get made.
Copy that, Sarge
The detectives in the car get alert and start their car a QUEENAN comes out of the building.
We got him.
Sarge, we got the target.
DETECTIVE 1 trails Captain Queenan through the crowds of people heading towards work.

head_text.subj: INT. PARK ST. SUBWAY STATION. MORNING

text: QUEENAN begins to light a cigarette and then gives it up. TRAIN comes in, and Queenan boards. DETECTIVE 1 boards th next car.

head_text.subj: INT. DETECTIVE 1'S SUBWAY CAR. MOMENTS LATER

text: Looking through smeared glass into the next car as the tr begins to move DETECTIVE 1 sees QUEENAN answer a cell cal
QUEENAN is on his cell.
Where are you now?
Look down the car.
QUEENAN looks up mildly as the car rocks.
Got me?
BILLY is slumped in a seat at the far end, not looking towards QUEENAN.
Any reason you'd have a tail?
No...Of course not.
(on the verge of hyperventilating) I'm watching a guy...
I don't have a tail, Billy.
Through the glass we see DETECTIVE 1 watching Queenan.
Okay. Get off at South Station. You wait there for ten minutes. After I leave I'll text message you the address where we'll meet. I'll make sure you don't have a tail.
South Station. Wait ten minutes.
As the train stops BILLY vaults off of it. On the platfor walks along, texting.

text: QUEENAN, mild in his specs, chewing gum with his dentures comes out of the station, and looks at the TEXT MESSAGE o his phone.

text: A building under rehab, covered with scaffolding, but sti functioning as a corporate building. QUEENAN goes along t the entrance, and in. DETECTIVE 1 comes along after him. We see the Internal Investigations car up the street. DETECTIVE 1 dials his cellphone.
He went into a building on the waterfront. Address is 344 Wash...
DETECTIVE 1 looks at the elevator-indicator, and the buil directory.
He went to the top floor. It's empty. No tenants.
COLIN, listening, playing with a COIN.
DETECTIVE 1 emerges from the building and joins other detectives in the car.
I don't know what we're doing here.
COLIN, after fumbling between cell phones, dials the corr one.
(to COSTELLO) I think I've got him. I think Queenan is meeting with him right now.

text: FITZY and DELAHUNT'S phones ring simultaneously.
Get the van. Get the boys.
BILLY is waiting on the roof as QUEENAN finally arrives.
I assume these premises do not have an anti-smoking ordinance. So, what's going on?
I told you, he's got dope coming in, I don't know where. He's getting spooky, Captain...
What do you mean?

He's crazy. I just saw the man. He had blood all over him. I can't get any more information for you. I can't trust it. He's not including his regular guys... I'm telling you, he's gonna find out who I am. He's gonna fuckin' kill me, I know it.

All right, all right. I hear you. I'm sorry for you trouble. Look, I'm not gonna jeopardize your safety any longer. I'll get you out. I can't do it overnight but I'll do it. We can bust him for what we have. At least I think we can...I hope. You're out of there ASAP.
BILLY nods, and nods.
Yeah?   What about the FBI?
They're compromised.
What?
They're fucked, just like this lighter.
BILLY'S phone rings.
DELAHUNT is calling Billy from a van crowded with Costell usual bad guys as it scorches through traffic.
Billy, where the fuck are you? We been trying to reach you. We found the rat. Top man says we're gonna take care of him. The address is 314 Washington Street. You got it? All right. See you there.
BILLY listens in horror, staring at the oblivious QUEENAN
What?
You were fucking followed.
By who?
Costello's people.
Impossible.
No. One of the cops he's got inside tipped him.
QUEENAN realizes that his enemy might be...
COLIN raises his eyes. Diabolical.
FITZY'S VAN stops outside the building. COSTELLO'S MEN ge out of the van, and head into the lobby.
The DETECTIVES are watching.
What the fuck is going on?
Holy fucking shit. Looks like Queenan's meeting with all of them.
COLIN listens.
Yes.
Billy and Queenan are running downstairs when they hear footsteps coming up from below. They immediately go back to the elevator lobby. Pushing through plastic sheeting.

location: LOBBY ON THE TOP FLOOR. CONTINUOUS

text: Billy is slamming elevator buttons. The indicator shows b elevators coming up.
They'll be on the elevators, too.
Take the back fire escape.
What'll you do?
I'll be fine. If you get made I can't protect you. Go down the fire escape. Now. That's an order. I'll be fine.

BILLY goes. Queenan waits. Watching the elevator indicato QUEENAN, in his specs, very mild, takes out his gun and breaks the cylinder, checking that it is loaded, and putt a shell into the empty sixth chamber.
BILLY climbs out onto the fire escape at the back of the building and starts dropping down, fast.

text: The elevator door opens, revealing DELAHUNT and BOYS. QUE looks right as the door to the staircase opens revealing FITZY and boys.
Can I help you gentlemen?
I guess we've had enough of this shit. Where's your boy?
QUEENAN doesn't answer, and never will. He draws his gun is tackled.

head_text.subj: EXT. BACK ALLEY, COMMERCIAL BUILDING. DAY

text: BILLY drops off the fire escape and runs down the alley.
BILLY towards the front doors just as-- QUEENAN'S BODY bounces off the scaffolding, smashes into pavement and explodes. BLOOD splashes all over BILLY.
DETECTIVE 1 screams into his headset.
Fuck!   Something came off the roof.
What came off the roof? What do you mean something came off the roof? Go again with that information.
FITZY, DELAHUNT and boys come out. The crew has seen the UNMARKED COP CAR. FITZY grabs BILLY.
You're fuckin' late. Where the fuck were you? Get in the fuckin' van.
What the fuck happened?    I came to meet you.
They start piling into a van.
DETECTIVE 2 is yelling both at his partner and into the m
Stay in the fucking car. Stay in the fucking car. This is a surveillance unit. (into mic to Colin) Do I pursue.
COLIN is sitting very calmly.
No. Stay where you are. I need some fucking information here. What came off the building?
I'm not sure.

location: INTERNAL INVESTIGATIONS CAR/ THE STREET. CONTIN

text: No pursuit. No pursuit.
Fuck that.

DETECTIVE 1 gets out of the car and runs towards the flee men, gun drawn. FITZY turns on DETECTIVE 1 with a pistol drawn. DETECTIVE fires and DELAHUNT is hit in the stomach. FITZY shoots th detective (he is wounded in the hand, not killed). The VA takes off.
Thirty-two X to CP. Thirty-two X to CP. We're being fired upon. I repeat.
ON RADIO. "Officer down", etc. COLIN has never felt more guilty in his life.
We have an officer down. An officer has been shot. Request immediate assistance.
He switches off the light and sits in the dark as the afternoon gathers.
FITZY, BILLY, and the BOYS are drinking. Dirty, paranoid, guilty, frightened, smoking. DELAHUNT has been shot, is dying, on a dirty couch. FITZY sits down and looks at Billy.
And where the fuck were you?
Boss told me to go home.
Maybe he did and maybe he didn't. At any rate you weren't fuckin' home.
I was in a fucking grocery store with no signal. When I got a signal I got the call. What the fuck do you want. Was I there or was I not there? Huh?
FITZY walks away.
Billy. Billy (Billy goes over to him)
(re: his wounds) Jesus Christ.

Two days...two days ago the Boss says to me, it's been ten years already, and you've never done me wrong. He asked me, if one of the other guys is a rat, would I take him out. I told him I would but I don't know if I would. Now I know I can't. I've done a lot of bad things but I've never been a murderer.
BILLY realizes that DELAHUNT is dying.
Hey Billy, I don't want no one to put me in a dumpster. Just don't put me in a dumpster.
When you're dead it makes no difference where they put you.
BILLY lights him a cigarette.
You know what I thought today?
What's that?
Who didn't show up today is the rat.
Yeah, so?
You never been late in your life. And when I called you... I made a mistake. I gave you the wrong address. But you showed up at the right one.
DELAHUNT grips his arm. BILLY is terrified.
Tell me why I didn't say anything. Tell me why.
He waits for DELAHUNT to continue. But DELAHUNT after an smile of complicity, finally dies. BILLY, the only one wh knows that DELAHUNT is dead, stares down at him.
(drinking) That cop was tough. We were excessive with the cop.
BILLY walks past the table.
He's dead. I'm going home.
BILLY leaves by the front door.
All hands present. Dignam is in a black silent rage.
Do you know why Queenan went to that building?
No.
A better question is why your fuckers were following him.
I told Internal Investigations to follow him.
Why?
That's internal Investigations business.

DIGNAM grabs COLIN by the neck and runs him into a wall. COLIN gets a palm under Dignam's chin and comes close to breaking his neck. The men at length are separated. COLIN straightens his good clothes.
I have to investigate everybody and anybody. I don't have to justify anything. Nor does anyone have to like it. I now have information...
from a very good source...that Queenan may have been killed by his own undercover.
COLIN is trying this on.
That's a fucking lie.
Captain Queenan and Staff Sergeant Dignam here have information on this undercover, and other informants, in a locked file. I need those files unlocked.
I don't have the password.   Why don't you come down to the garage...
That's a lie.
DIGNAM hits COLIN in the face. COLIN goes down hard, into crook of a file cabinet and the wall. Blood from his mout
No one calls me a liar. Especially when I'm lying.
Everybody shut up. (to BROWN) Work with the tech guys to unlock the files. Dignam. You take a leave of absence.
Leave of what?
Queenan's dead. That makes me your boss.
I'll hand in my papers first.
What?
Hey, world needs plenty of bartenders. Two weeks with pay.
Good.
I need those codes.
No, you want those codes.
When she comes out: BILLY is waiting.
I tried to call you a few times.
I know.     (I know.).   I can't...
He leans close to her.    She strokes his head.
I can't be a friend to you. I can't. I'm sorry.
It's okay, okay, I know.
MADOLYN walks away.

COLIN needs a shower and is gun-shy as people move past t glass windows. He is still rinsing blood out of his mouth COSTELLO is listening to LUCIA di LAMMAMOOR. GWEN sits ne in attractive lingerie, reading a book.
Now, when I hear Lucia, I can't stop thinking about the cocaine curtsy you did on that nigger broad's face. (the phone rings. Costello answers:) What?
(into phone) Your shouldn't have killed Queenan.
One of us was going to have to die. With me it tends to be the other guy.
(agitated) You're crazy, Frank. You killed the guy who has all the information. And Dignam's not in the office, he's gone. He resigned.
I don't give a fuck about Dignam.
He's fucking gone. They took his papers in. He's not talking. I don't know where he is.
Don't get your balls in an uproar, Collie. That Irish piss-ant won't be a problem. He's so hot for me, we give him a whiff of my ass, he'll crawl right in it. Let's give him a whiff.
I will.
Don't worry. I'll take care of it.
COSTELLO turns to the GWEN.
Sweetheart, you're giving me a hard- on.
He starts to dial the phone.
Are you sure it's me or all that talk about whiffin' and crawlin' up asses?
Hey, watch your fucking mouth.
You watch it.
She rises and as she crosses:
Let me straighten you out.

COLIN looks out into the bullpen. People working. On a ta he sees PLASTIC BAGS which contains Queenan's bloodstaine effects-- broken glasses, smashed wristwatch, and CELLPHO He glances around, and picks up the CELLPHONE. Blood gets his fingers. He moves into the office, and seen through t glass, he seizes the phone and with trembling fingers pun up the last incoming number.

head_text.subj: INT. BILLY'S MOTHER'S APARTMENT KITCHEN. NIGHT

text: BILLY is looking at a chipped SANTA MUG from his childhoo and is eating something--sheer maintenance, and drinking from the bottle. His phone rings. He looks at the ID and stunned. Queenan's number! He picks up the call but remai silent. The caller is also doing the same.
COLIN hears that the other side has hung up the phone. He sees: ELLERBY looking at him through the glass. But Eller hasn't seen the phone. INTERCUT BILLY'S MOTHER'S APARTMENT/COLIN'S OFFICE #2.

BILLY is agitated. Exhausted. Frightened. He paces, and l at the phone. He begins to pack, assembling clothes, mone Finally, like a man committing suicide--it's that intense he dials the number. INTERCUT.
Yeah.
You called this number on a dead guy's phone. Who are you?
So it is you. Thank God you're all right. We were very worried.
Who are you?
You're talking to Sergeant Sullivan. I'm taking over Queenan's unit.
Let me talk to Dignam to confirm it.
Staff Sgt. Dignam has... taken a leave of absence. He's very upset. We're all very upset. The best thing would be for your to come in. We need you to come in.

BILLY listens to Colin go on. Then shuts off the phone. H other phone rings. COLIN dumps out the box of Queenan's belongings. In the diary he sees an entry showing undercover suspects Costel is FBI informant. BILLY listens to Colin go on. Then shuts off the phone. H other phone rings.

head_text.subj: INT. THE CHARLES STREET BRASSERIE. DAY

text: COSTELLO is sitting with his key guys, including FRENCH a FITZY. A TV station plays above the zinc bar. BILLY is drinking, hitting it heavily.

State Police have confirmed that the body of the man found dead in the Fenway marshes yesterday afternoon is that of Timothy Delahunt, an undercover policeman for the City of Boston.. This was the scene today.... If you have any information about this murder, you are urged to call the Boston Police.
The TV shows DELAHUNT'S BODY being loaded into an ambulan A crime scene. COSTELLO's eyes have widened slightly. But is strangely undisturbed.
Fuck.   I can't believe it.
Don't believe what?

I'm embarrassed. How the fuck did they find him so fast? I spent all fuckin' night out there, dragged the poor bastard.... I must have been there seven hours. In three feet of mud. What the fuck is a marsh? And who walks their dog in a fuckin' marsh? In three feet of water? I don't believe it. I still don't believe he's a fuckin' cop.

The cops are saying he's a cop so I won't look for the cop. (to FITZY) Are you soft? The next time I tell you to dump a body in the marshes, put it in the fuckin' marshes, not where some guy from John Hancock goes every Thursday to get a blowjob!
He makes a move for the door.
Proceed.
They get up to leave, following him.
Two cars carrying Costello and his men are speeding down highway. Behind them, two SIU CARS are trailing.
COLIN closes his door and punches in a number. IN COSTELLO'S CAR, his cell phone rings.
Jesus Christ.
He answers it.
What?
Don't go. You've got a tail. Two cars. Not very subtle. They won't be subtle from now on. That's what I've been trying to tell you.
Get rid of them.
There's no need to go yourself, Frank.
Get rid of the fuckin' tail!
CLOSE on COLIN as what he has to do crystallizes.
I will.   All right.
A cold look in his eye, Colin leaves his office and goes the hall.
Costello remarks to French --
Tails. Fuckin' rats. This rat shit is wearing me thin.
Francis, they're all rats. Women are rats... cunts...Yeah, we're becoming a nation of rats.
BROWN is there. BARRIGAN. ELLERBY. Others.
Stop. Stop. Pull these guys off. Tell your team to stop following Costello. We don't need to surveil him.
COLIN stands in the door like a gunfighter. Everyone look him.
What the fuck are you talking about?
I have it from an undercover: Costello knows he's being followed. Let our UC take him in.
What informant?
Queenan's guy. He called me when he found out Queenan was dead. I'm running him.
Everyone is impressed.
No.   You give him to me.
No. But I can give you Costello's destination.
You know where he's going?
Yes. And what he's about to do. Call off the tail, and get Special Ops. Get them on standby. We meet him where he's going. Suit up. We're gonna take this prick tonight.
(to crew on the road) All units fall back.
Everyone moves at once.

COSTELLO is checking the rearview mirror. He sees: The TW SIU CARS exit the highway onto Atlantic Avenue. COSTELLO smiles. The cars exit the highway. The cars pass through a maze o industrial streets.
BILLY, riding in the back seat, is trying desperately to where they are. He sees a STREET SIGN and taps out a text message on his phone.
COLIN, in vest, observed by Brown, reads the message.
It's the heavy equipment warehouse Costello owns on Sheffield. He must have a container or a truck in there. (his big moment of decision) Go.

It is an unfinished structure, the lower parts used, the upper parts accessible but still under construction. It i built on a pier, the harbor lights beyond it. The COMMAND and POLICE CARS pull up with lights off. A TACTICAL VAN disgorges TACTICAL OFFICERS who spread out through the da INT. COMMAND VAN. CONTINUOUS.
(into mic) There's an exit on the other side. Cover it. We'll take him when he comes out.
COLIN checks the load on his pistol.

location: AN UPPER FLOOR OF THE PARKING GARAGE. CONTINUOUS

text: COSTELLO unlocks a CONTAINER with a construction company on it, opens the doors, and steps back. BILLY looks into container. It's cocaine or heroin in kilo bricks. Men sta around with MP5s under their coats.
Load it.
BILLY, trying to save Costello...
How do you know you don't have a tail?
COSTELLO looks at him.
Were you in the fuckin' car?
What if they took one off and put another one on, Frank?
Load.
The drugs having been loaded fast by the crew, including FNG's, the container is hosed out. BILLY turns from FITZY CAR as everyone gets it.
Frank told me to check out the back. You guys go ahead.
Watch your ass.
Instead of getting into COSTELLO'S CAR on the other side the container, he steps back into shadows as both cars le
FOUR CARS with no headlights bracket the vehicles as soon they come out of the garage. COSTELLO realizes that somet has gone wrong.
Cocksucker.

LIGHTS come on, and Policemen are everywhere, guns in the hands. COLIN is not visible among them. POLICE open fire at Costello's car. THE CAR reverses back into the garage. MISTER FRENCH (the driver) is shot in th arm, and the car crashes into a wall. A gunfight opens up FNG's exchange fire with brutally efficient tactical cops are shot down expertly. COSTELLO, limping, gets out of th action, fast. He runs into the parking garage. French dri away (alternately is shot, or commits suicide).

COSTELLO, shot through the stomach, is moving through the dark. All that's stored in this garage is heavy equipment the big dig. Plenty of places to hide. We hear gunfire in distance. COSTELLO hides between two pieces of heavy equipment and dials his telephone. To his surprise the ph rings quite nearby. And keeps ringing.
COSTELLO moves out into the open, and sees, at a near distance, COLIN, his shadow long on the concrete. He has gun in his hand. Costello moves out to face him.
You're an FBI informant.
COSTELLO comes out of the shadows.
Jesus Colin, grow up. Course I'm talking to the FBI.
Do they know who I am?
COSTELLO says nothing for a moment.
I never gave up anybody who wasn't goin' down anyway.
COLIN instantly raises the pistol to shoot him.
Did you give me up?
COLIN'S PISTOL wavers.
Nobody knows nothin'.
COLIN shakes his head and cocks the gun.
Frank, Frank, do they know about me?
I know you, Colin. You know I'd never give you up. You're like...
A son...to you? Is that what it is about, all that murderin' and fuckin' and no sons? What are you, shooting blanks?
COSTELLO tries to raise his gun which is inside his sleev He's sitting on his coat so that the shot goes off sidewa as COLIN shoots him.

COSTELLO topples backward into the bucket of the bucket loader. ANGLE ON COLIN. Then from the bucket loader, a post death tremor sets off last shot from COSTELLO'S gun. Ricochet. COLIN fires into dead body again and again. He backs away.
I got Costello! I got Costello here!
Colin is debriefed concerning the shooting of Costello. [Dialog separate document].

COLIN enters, tired from a debriefing. Applause from ever in the office--the full crew. COLIN is embarrassed by the attention. BROWN is leading the whole team to a standing ovation. COLIN looks past the heads of the crowd and sees Dignam, staring at him evenly.
(to crowd) It's not any reason for, ah...
QUEENAN'S SECRETARY brings him some wine.
Thank you.
No, thank you.
He takes a glass of wine. Then guiltily, almost in tears, drinks. BROWN jerks a thumb towards Colin's office #2.
He's waited a long time for you. (COLIN looks up and sees BILLY) How'd you get him without the files?
Caller ID. On Queenan's phone. You know that guy?
Yeah, we were classmates together.
I'm gonna go talk to him.
COLIN goes off.
In Colin's office BILLY sits with his ankle on his knee. looks very tired, dirty. Wearing a VISITOR badge.
Good to see you Trooper.
Yeah.   "Trooper".
Colin Sullivan. We spoke on the phone. How long have you been undercover?
Long time.     Long fuckin' time.
I can't begin to tell you what a debt we owe you. I want you to know I'll be recommending you for the Medal of Merit.
Medal of Merit. Oh, yeah. That's kinda like a gold star around here, right?
It's the highest honor we got.
I just want my identity back.
You want to be a cop again?
No, being a cop's not an identity. I want my identity back.
COLIN takes it.
You'll have to excuse me. My only contact has been with a police shrink.
(throat clicks) A police shrink. (instead of asking the obvious) Was that... helpful for you?
What are you gonna do about the rat in this building?
I'm gonna find him. Don't you worry about that. You got anything? Did Frank, ah, say anything...
I'm all done being a cop. I just want to get my money and go home.
Fair enough. You've given a lot. I can get you your file. I just need your password.
The password's my name, William Costigan, Jr. They gave it to me in case something happened to them and I had to explain myself to someone like you.
He writes it.    Colin takes the paper and hides his astonishment.
All right, Bill. Just give me a minute. I'm gonna go in the other room. This computer's gone blooey on me.
Billy nods.    He goes.
COLIN accesses the personal database, enters the password Billy's confidential file opens up. Every fact about the Photos.

Billy takes a drink from the bottle COLIN has put on the desk. As he puts the bottle down he sees, sticking out of box, a BROWN ENVELOPE. On it is written "CITIZENS." BILLY picks up the envelope...and knows everything.
COLIN is reviewing it Billy's file. Outside the glass wal see BILLY, staring at COLIN's back...and then moving on.

COLIN enters, holding a printout of Billy's personnel fil He looks around the empty room. He sees the BROWN ENVELOP lying on the desk, and understands everything. He sits do at his own computer--which does in fact work, and opens t personnel file. COLIN clicks DELETE. "Do You Really Want to Delete?" COLI clicks "Yes" and Billy's picture, file, life, disappear.
BILLY exits the police building and moves across the plaz
BILLY waits outside Madolyn's office. MADOLYN, carrying work, breakfast, rounds the corner and him standing and waiting for her. She's a little spooked, opens her mouth to speak...
I know. I'm not here to...I'm not here for that. I've got something to...to give to you...something I need you to keep. For me.
What is it?
(stopping her from speaking) I need you to be my friend here and not ask any questions. That's for you to hold.
He gives her a manila envelope.
Only you. Open this if I'm dead or if I call you and tell you to open it. Please do exactly what it says. Exactly what it says, please.
Madolyn is a friend. She's not going to ask questions. accepts the envelope.
All right.
I'm sorry to show up here like this. There was no one else I could give it to. I'm sorry. There was no one else.
He backs away, and then turns to go.
I...we... (he turns) I've, it's, been so confused... I just want to say...
He turns and looks at her.          She doesn't speak: ca
Whatever you have to say, really think about it, and if you still want to tell me, tell me in two weeks, all right?

She moves her head slightly, watches him go. INT. MADOLYN'S OFFICE. MOMENTS LATER. MADOLYN sits at her desk, devastated, looking at a fall o light. The envelope lies on her blotter. She sits on ... then straightens up, takes a marker and writes "COSTIGAN" the envelope and puts it in her desk drawer.
We DISSOLVE to a SONOGRAM.
A SONOGRAM picture of a fetus. It looks to him at first l a CCTV picture blown up. COLIN stares as if at something horror film.
I was dreaming...
What?
I was dreaming I was dead.
Death is hard. Life is much easier.
Referring to the envelope
What's this?
Open it
He does.
Really?
Yeah.
Really?
Yeah.
You're joking...
It's not a joke, it's a human being.
Colin belatedly thinks of what a human being might do in these circumstances and kisses her.

COLIN is in the shower. MADOLYN moves into the     kitche puts the kettle on. She checks the mail, lying     there counter. It's tied with a string. She undoes       the st sorts through the mail. Suddenly, she freezes      lookin AN OVERSIZED ENVELOPE addressed to COLIN: [COLIN SULLIVAN Pickering Street, Apt TK, Boston, MA, zip TK], with a ret address of Wm. Costigan, 13 Conant St., Boston, etc., etc MADOLYN stares at the envelope, listening to the shower going. Billy has written to her fiance. She starts to put the envelope down, and then realizes...she has to hide it...she has to open it. Inside the envelope is a jewel case: EXILE ON MAIN STREET And a note: PLAY ME NOW. MADOLYN puts the CD into the machine. She puts on the headset and listens...and listen COLIN comes out of the bathroom, dressed in jeans and t- shirt, barefoot, his hair wet. He looks at Madolyn, realizing that something is wrong.
What?
MADOLYN pulls the headphone jack out of the stereo and roughly the following booms out of the speakers. [NOTE: T
Your guys shouldn't have done that.
One of us was going to have to die. It tends to be the other guy.
COLIN stares at her and we ought to think murder is a possibility.
I'm now in charge of everything here. Including Queenan's informers. Theoretically. I can't unlock the files until after the brass squeezes Dignam. If the brass squeezes Dignam.
So Dignam's the only one with the keys to the kingdom.
He's fucking resigning. He put his papers in. He's not talking.
Give me his location. Tonight.
COLIN and MADOLYN stare at each other.
I thought I was the liar.
I can explain.
She goes into the bedroom. COLIN'S PHONE RINGS. He answer it.
BILLY is walking, on the phone, happy, and twisting the knife.

Costello recorded everything. He put all the tapes in a little box and kept them with his lawyer. That was his insurance. His lawyer came to me. Costello trusted me the most. Imagine that you rat fuck. Sound quality good enough? I was a little worried.
COLIN closes a door to speak privately.
What do you want?
I want my identity, you two-faced rat prick.
Where are you?
Three o'clock. Where Queenan died. You keep your cell on.
COLIN goes to the bedroom door and tries it. Locked. He knocks. No answer.
Did we not talk about this?   This is my job.
It's over. He starts to punch the door, and then does not
COLIN comes along and walks into the lobby. He is not loo for a tail...

COLIN looks out through the door, no gun drawn, but very a cop clearing his corners. He steps out and--BILLY takes from behind the door, his only blind side, and grabs the of his collar and crams a pistol into the bottom of his skull.
Get your hands up.   Hands.   Hands.
Put the fuckin' gun down.

BILLY turns Colin around and puts the pistol to Colin's forehead, hard enough to break the skin. He takes out Col belt gun and puts it in his pocket. (Billy screams "hands at Colin every time he makes a move).
I came here to talk some fucking sense to you. You get a hold of yourself and put down the fuckin' firearm and act professional and I can get you your money.
(turning him around) What did you say?
I can get you your...
BILLY cracks him across the jaw with the gun. COLIN goes down. COLIN is drooling blood, his bell rung, one eye ope Billy throws away Colin's ankle gun.
(spitting teeth) Fuck, shit...
(going for Colin's cuffs) You didn't come here to talk, you fuckin' maggot, you came here to get arrested.
Arrested? Arrested for what. (as BILLY cuffs him) So you got tapes of what? Costello was my informant. I was his rat? Fuck you. Prove it. I say he was my informant.
Get up and shut your fuckin' mouth.
What is this, a citizen's arrest? Blow me, prick. Only one of us is a cop, here, Bill. Nobody knows who you are. Nobody knows who you are.
Would you shut the fuck up.
I'm a sergeant in the Mass. State Police. Who the fuck are you? Nobody. I ERASED YOU.
BILLY puts the gun to Colin's head.
You erased me?
Go ahead. Shoot a cop, Einstein. See what happens.
What would happen is the bullet would go right through your fuckin' head.
Watch what happens.
What, you think you're gonna get the parade? The bagpipes and bullshit? Fuck you. (safeties the gun) I'm arresting you.
That's the stupidest thing you could do.
Shut up, shut up, shut the fuck up. (hits him) I don't give a fuck if these charges don't stick. (whaling him in the beats) But I'm still fucking arresting you.
COLIN is hammered to his knees. Head down, blood in his hair, drooling blood, thinking (impossibly) about his nex move. He seems to realize he's fucked.
[You are what you do.] Get up. (COLIN doesn't move.) I said get the fuck up.
BILLY grabs the back of Colin's collar and puts the gun t Colin's head. A crunch of gravel, off. BILLY and COLIN bo hear it.
Put down the weapon and step away from Sergeant Sullivan.
BILLY drags COLIN to his feet and using Colin as a shield aims the pistol at: BROWN. Brown is aiming his weapon.
I called you. You specifically. You know who I am. I'm not gonna shoot. I told you to meet me downstairs.
Help me.
Billy realizes he's in a truly shitty situation:   appear are everything.
Put the weapon on the deck and step away from Sergeant Sullivan.
(a mess, bloody-mouthed) Shoot the fuckin' prick.
(desperqte) Where's Dignam? I told you to bring Dignam!
Shoot the motherfucker!
Put the weapon on the ground and we'll discuss it.
He was Costello's rat. I got evidence. Tapes. Other documents.
Maybe you do, but right now I need you to drop the weapon.
I told you I've got the evidence cold linking this prick to Costello... (BROWN wavers) You fuckin' know who I am. I'm taking him downstairs now.
BROWN, weapon ready, follows into the elevator lobby.
BILLY moves COLIN into the elevator and as the doors clos looks back at BROWN, still in a Mexican stand-off. COLIN, nose broken, blood masking his face.
I can't wait for you to try to explain this to a Suffolk County grand jury. This is gonna be fun.
The indicator ticks. Down, down, down. Colin sobs.
Just fucking kill me.
I am killing you.

The doors open and for a frozen moment BILLY, holding the on COLIN, stares out of the car. A LOUD BANG. BILLY is sh through the head. BLOOD sprays the walls, and COLIN is hi flying blood and matter. BILLY falls, crumpled, on his fa half in and half out of the elevator. The doors try to close...open...COLIN, covered with blood, looks up. BARRIGAN lowers his pistol. COLIN slumps, covered with blood. BARRIGAN uncuffs him. C feels his wrists. BARRIGAN picks up BILLY'S gun. The othe elevator doors open and BROWN emerges. He looks into the bloody elevator and down at the dead man.
(holstering his gun) Shit...
BARRIGAN raises BILLY'S GUN and shoots BROWN in the head. COLIN stares at him.
Did you think you were the only one he had? Costello was going to sell us to the FBI. It's you and me now. We have to take care of each other. You understand?
All right. Give me that.
BARRIGAN casually hands COLIN BILLY'S GUN. COLIN presses gun against BARRIGAN's forehead and fires.
POLICE TAPE, plenty of cars. Three corpses being loaded o ambulances. COLIN, hands free, is drinking coffee from a paper cup, being checked out by a doctor.
COLIN has been cleaned up a little by paramedics. He's ma had his lip stitched, but he's still wearing his bloody clothes.

At that time, Trooper Barrigan, who I now understand to have been Francis Costello's informer in SIU, intercepted us in the lobby and shot Trooper William Costigan once in the head. (drinks water) At that time Barrigan retrieved Trooper Costigan's undercover weapon and shot Trooper Brown as he was approaching our location. I attempted to subdue Trooper Barrigan and in the ensuing struggle was struck several times with the Walther pistol. I was able to wrestle the weapon away, at which time Barrigan drew his own weapon and took aim at me. I was able to get off a single shot, striking Barrigan in the head. I then checked for vital signs of Troopers Brown and Costigan and discovered that they had expired.
COLIN looks up, eyes clear, perfectly believable.   As we transition to the FUNERAL...bagpipes coming up.
I'd like to go on record that I am recommending Trooper William Costigan for the Medal of Merit.
BAGPIPES (Something like"Cross of Fire") as we DISSOLVE T

BILLY'S GRAVESITE. The same cemetery as his mother is bur in. UNIFORMED POLICEMEN (not only State, but MDC, the way they do it, for "brother officers"), saluting. MADOLYN is at the gravesite, dry-eyed though in, distinct apart from COLIN. He looks at her. She looks away from hi apparently forever.
COLIN squares off: his job in the world is to get ahead. salute is fired with rifles. But later... COLIN and MADOLYN are walking through the graves.
What about the baby?
She moves away from him without answering. MADOLYN walks through the cemetery gates. COLIN hesitates.

head_text.subj: INT. THE STAIRWAY OF COLIN'S APARTMENT. EVENING

text: COLIN has a bag of expensive groceries and wine. Living t Beacon Hill dream. He climbs the steps slowly. He nods to neighbor, an old lady coming down with her dog (who incidentally will never accept him as a neighbor, and COL briefly seems aware of this). (Don't be afraid to get a b French here). He gets to his door, and starts to cry, and nearly crumples. But he gets the door open. He looks up a sees a gun. Behind it, stepping fast out of the shadows, DIGNAM. Avenging a guy he didn't even like, because it's right thing to do. COLIN looks down and sees that Dignam plastic hospital boots on his feet.
(accepting it, sort of, but only in a COLIN way) OK.

DIGNAM fires. Flash groceries fall all over the floor. DIGNAM'S FEET step over COLIN's body, crushing one of a h dozen croissants, and DIGNAM goes down the expensive staircase, leaving the door to the apartment open. The strangest thing happens: a rat emerges and begins to eat dead man's croissants. The rat hears something and runs s it's not in the shot when it FREEZES.
